original: Lidmalm, Tord Nils Gösta, civilingenjör, Linköping, f. 22/12/13 i Sunne, Värml. 1., av Gustaf L. o. Signe Larsson. G. 41 m. Märta Skogberg. Barn: Bengt f. 43. — Stud:ex. i Karlstad 33, Bröd. Påhlmans handelsinst. 34, KTH 35-39. Ans t. v. Götaverkens flygavd. 39, finl. statens flygmaskinsfabr. 40, projekting. v. Sv. Aeroplan A-B 40, chef f. konstr :kont. där sed. 46. Res. t. Central- o. Nordamerika 36, Tyskl. 37 samt m. stip. fr. K. o. A. Wallen-bergs stift. f. stud. av flygind. i USA 46. Har konstr. följande byggda flyg-l5lan: segelflygpl. Fi-1 (43), lastghd-planet Fi-3 (44), 24-32-sitsiga transp:-flygpl. SAAB Scandia (46). Medl. av Flygtekn. fören.
translated:
Lidmalm, Tord Nils Gösta, civil engineer, Linköping, b. 12/22/13 in Sunne, Värmland, 1st child of Gustaf L. and Signe Larsson. Married in 1941 to Märta Skogberg. Children: Bengt b. 1943. 
Education: Passed student examination in Karlstad in 1933, Bröderna Påhlman's School of Commerce in 1934, Royal Institute of Technology (KTH) from 1935 to 1939. 
Employment: Employed at Götaverken's aviation department from 1939, Finnish government's aircraft factory in 1940, project engineer at Svenska Aeroplan AB in 1940, later became head of the construction department there from 1946. 
Travels: Traveled to Central and North America in 1936, Germany in 1937, and received a scholarship from the K. and A. Wallenberg Foundation to study the aircraft industry in the USA in 1946. 
Constructed the following aircrafts: the sailplane Fi-1 (1943), the cargo plane Fi-3 (1944), the 24-32 seater transport plane SAAB Scandia (1946). 
Member of the Aeronautical Engineering Association.

scholarships.title: Study of the Aircraft Industry in USA
